iaik.smime
Interface CryptoContent

All Known Implementing Classes:
CompressedContent, EncryptedContent, ReceiptContent, SignedContent, SMimeContent
public interface CryptoContent

Interface to be implemented by all IAIK CryptoContent implementations.

This interface requires to implement only two methods, setHeaders to set additional headers/parameters for the part containing the CryptoContent and getContentType for getting the type of the crypto content. Within the S/MIME library of IAIK-CMS this interface is implemented by the three classes EncryptedContent, SignedContent and PKCS10Content setting the following headers, respectively:

  • EncryptedContent: 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p7m"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
  • SignedContent (implicit, signed-data): 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p7s"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
  • SignedContent (implicit, certs-only): 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p7c"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
  • PKCS10Content: 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p10"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
The following content types are returned by method getContentType():
  • EncryptedContent: 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p7m"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
  • SignedContent (implicit, signed-data): 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p7s"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
  • SignedContent (implicit, certs-only): 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p7c"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
  • PKCS10Content: 
         Content-Disposition: attachment";
       filename="smime.p10"
     Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64

Method Summary
 java.lang.String getContentType()
          Returns the ContentType and any attached parameters of this CryptoContent.
 java.lang.String getSMimeType()
          Returns the smime-type parameter of the ContentType of this CryptoContent.
 void setHeaders(javax.mail.Part part)
          Sets additional headers/parameters for the part containing this CryptoContent.
